trans-unit.source: Azure Data Catalog frequently asked questions
trans-unit.target: Azure Data Catalog frequently asked questions

trans-unit.source: Frequently asked questions about Azure Data Catalog preview, including capabilities for data source discovery, annotation, and management.
trans-unit.target: Frequently asked questions about Azure Data Catalog preview, including capabilities for data source discovery, annotation, and management.

trans-unit.source: This article provides answers for frequently asked questions related to the Microsoft Azure Data Catalog service.
trans-unit.target: This article provides answers for frequently asked questions related to the Microsoft Azure Data Catalog service.

trans-unit.source: A: Microsoft Azure Data Catalog is a fully managed service hosted in the Microsoft Azure cloud that serves as a system of registration and system of discovery for enterprise data sources.
trans-unit.target: A: Microsoft Azure Data Catalog is a fully managed service hosted in the Microsoft Azure cloud that serves as a system of registration and system of discovery for enterprise data sources.

trans-unit.source: Azure Data Catalog provides capabilities that enable any user – from analysts to data scientists to developers – to register, discover, understand, and consume data sources.
trans-unit.target: Azure Data Catalog provides capabilities that enable any user – from analysts to data scientists to developers – to register, discover, understand, and consume data sources.

trans-unit.source: Azure Data Catalog addresses the challenge of data source discovery and “dark data” by allowing users to discover and understand enterprise data sources.
trans-unit.target: Azure Data Catalog addresses the challenge of data source discovery and “dark data” by allowing users to discover and understand enterprise data sources.

trans-unit.source: Azure Data Catalog provides capabilities for technical and non-technical users, including:
trans-unit.target: Azure Data Catalog provides capabilities for technical and non-technical users, including:

trans-unit.source: Data Developers, BI and Analytics Professionals: Who are responsible for producing data and analytics content for others to consume
trans-unit.target: Data Developers, BI and Analytics Professionals: Who are responsible for producing data and analytics content for others to consume

trans-unit.source: Data Stewards: Those who have the knowledge about the data, what it means and how it is intended to be used and for which purpose
trans-unit.target: Data Stewards: Those who have the knowledge about the data, what it means and how it is intended to be used and for which purpose

trans-unit.source: Data Consumers: Those who need to be able to easily discover, understand and connect to data needed to do their job using the tool of their choice
trans-unit.target: Data Consumers: Those who need to be able to easily discover, understand and connect to data needed to do their job using the tool of their choice

trans-unit.source: Central IT: Those who need to make hundreds of data sources discoverable for the business users, and who need to maintain oversight over how data is being used and by whom
trans-unit.target: Central IT: Those who need to make hundreds of data sources discoverable for the business users, and who need to maintain oversight over how data is being used and by whom

trans-unit.source: During preview, Azure Data Catalog services are available only in the following data centers:
trans-unit.target: During preview, Azure Data Catalog services are available only in the following data centers:

trans-unit.source: US West
trans-unit.target: US West

trans-unit.source: US East
trans-unit.target: US East

trans-unit.source: Europe West
trans-unit.target: Europe West

trans-unit.source: Australia East
trans-unit.target: Australia East

trans-unit.source: The Free Edition of Azure Data Catalog is limited to 5,000 registered data assets.
trans-unit.target: The Free Edition of Azure Data Catalog is limited to 5,000 registered data assets.

trans-unit.source: The Standard Edition of Azure Data Catalog supports up to 100,000 registered data assets.
trans-unit.target: The Standard Edition of Azure Data Catalog supports up to 100,000 registered data assets.

trans-unit.source: During preview, Azure Data Catalog currently supports the SQL Server relational (including Azure SQL DB) and SQL Server Analysis Services (multidimensional and tabular) databases as well as SQL Server Reporting Services (native mode only) and Oracle Database.
trans-unit.target: During preview, Azure Data Catalog currently supports the SQL Server relational (including Azure SQL DB) and SQL Server Analysis Services (multidimensional and tabular) databases as well as SQL Server Reporting Services (native mode only) and Oracle Database.

trans-unit.source: During preview, Azure Data Catalog supports the following asset types:
trans-unit.target: During preview, Azure Data Catalog supports the following asset types:

trans-unit.source: SQL Server Table
trans-unit.target: SQL Server Table

trans-unit.source: SQL Server View
trans-unit.target: SQL Server View

trans-unit.source: SQL Server Analysis Services Dimension
trans-unit.target: SQL Server Analysis Services Dimension

trans-unit.source: SQL Server Analysis Services Measure
trans-unit.target: SQL Server Analysis Services Measure

trans-unit.source: SQL Server Analysis Services KPI
trans-unit.target: SQL Server Analysis Services KPI

trans-unit.source: SQL Server Analysis Services Table
trans-unit.target: SQL Server Analysis Services Table

trans-unit.source: SQL Server Reporting Services Report
trans-unit.target: SQL Server Reporting Services Report

trans-unit.source: Oracle Database Table
trans-unit.target: Oracle Database Table

trans-unit.source: Oracle Database View
trans-unit.target: Oracle Database View

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage Blob
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage Blob

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage Directory
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage Directory

trans-unit.source: HDFS File
trans-unit.target: HDFS File

trans-unit.source: HDSF Directory
trans-unit.target: HDSF Directory

trans-unit.source: Feature requests and other feedback can be submitted in the <linkText>Azure Data Catalog forum</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Feature requests and other feedback can be submitted in the <linkText>Azure Data Catalog forum</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The best place to get started is by following the instructions in Getting Started with Data Catalog.
trans-unit.target: The best place to get started is by following the instructions in Getting Started with Data Catalog.

trans-unit.source: This article is an end-to-end tour of the capabilities in the public preview.
trans-unit.target: This article is an end-to-end tour of the capabilities in the public preview.

trans-unit.source: To register your data in Azure Data Catalog, launch the Azure Data Catalog registration tool from the “Publish” area of the Azure Data Catalog portal.
trans-unit.target: To register your data in Azure Data Catalog, launch the Azure Data Catalog registration tool from the “Publish” area of the Azure Data Catalog portal.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Data Catalog publishing application, log in using the same credentials you use to access the Azure Data Catalog portal, and then select the data source and the specific assets you wish to register.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Data Catalog publishing application, log in using the same credentials you use to access the Azure Data Catalog portal, and then select the data source and the specific assets you wish to register.

trans-unit.source: The specific properties will differ from data source to data source, but in general the Azure Data Catalog publishing service will extract the following information:
trans-unit.target: The specific properties will differ from data source to data source, but in general the Azure Data Catalog publishing service will extract the following information:

trans-unit.source: Asset Name
trans-unit.target: Asset Name

trans-unit.source: Asset Type
trans-unit.target: Asset Type

trans-unit.source: Asset Description
trans-unit.target: Asset Description

trans-unit.source: Attribute/Column Names
trans-unit.target: Attribute/Column Names

trans-unit.source: Attribute/Column Data Types
trans-unit.target: Attribute/Column Data Types

trans-unit.source: Attribute/Column Description
trans-unit.target: Attribute/Column Description

trans-unit.source: Azure Data Catalog does not move or copy your data to the cloudAzure.
trans-unit.target: Azure Data Catalog does not move or copy your data to the cloudAzure.

trans-unit.source: Registering assets from a data source will copy the assets’ metadata to Azure, but the data remains in the existing data source location.
trans-unit.target: Registering assets from a data source will copy the assets’ metadata to Azure, but the data remains in the existing data source location.

trans-unit.source: The only exception to this rule is if a user chooses to upload preview records when registering assets.
trans-unit.target: The only exception to this rule is if a user chooses to upload preview records when registering assets.

trans-unit.source: In this case, up to 20 records will be copied from each asset, and stored as a snapshot in Azure Data Catalog.
trans-unit.target: In this case, up to 20 records will be copied from each asset, and stored as a snapshot in Azure Data Catalog.

trans-unit.source: For data sources such as SQL Server Analysis Services that have a first-class Description property, the Azure Data Catalog publishing application will extract that property value.
trans-unit.target: For data sources such as SQL Server Analysis Services that have a first-class Description property, the Azure Data Catalog publishing application will extract that property value.

trans-unit.source: For SQL Server relational databases, which lack a first-class Description property, the Azure Data Catalog publishing application will extract the value from the ms_description extended property for objects and columns.
trans-unit.target: For SQL Server relational databases, which lack a first-class Description property, the Azure Data Catalog publishing application will extract the value from the ms_description extended property for objects and columns.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see TechNet <linkText>Using Extended Properties on Database Objects</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see TechNet <linkText>Using Extended Properties on Database Objects</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: After you register assets with Azure Data Catalog there may be a period of 5-10 seconds before they appear in the Azure Data Catalog portal.
trans-unit.target: After you register assets with Azure Data Catalog there may be a period of 5-10 seconds before they appear in the Azure Data Catalog portal.

trans-unit.source: The simplest way to provide metadata for registered assets is to select the asset in the Azure Data Catalog portal and then enter the metadata values in the properties pane or schema pane for the selected object.
trans-unit.target: The simplest way to provide metadata for registered assets is to select the asset in the Azure Data Catalog portal and then enter the metadata values in the properties pane or schema pane for the selected object.

trans-unit.source: You can also provide some metadata, such as experts and tags, during the registration process.
trans-unit.target: You can also provide some metadata, such as experts and tags, during the registration process.

trans-unit.source: The values provided in the Azure Data Catalog publishing service will apply to all assets being registered at that time.
trans-unit.target: The values provided in the Azure Data Catalog publishing service will apply to all assets being registered at that time.

trans-unit.source: To view the recently-registered objects in the portal for additional annotation, select the View Portal button on the final screen of the Azure Data Catalog publishing application.
trans-unit.target: To view the recently-registered objects in the portal for additional annotation, select the View Portal button on the final screen of the Azure Data Catalog publishing application.

trans-unit.source: You can delete an object from Azure Data Catalog by selecting the object in the portal, and then clicking the Delete button.
trans-unit.target: You can delete an object from Azure Data Catalog by selecting the object in the portal, and then clicking the Delete button.

trans-unit.source: This will remove the metadata for the object from Azure Data Catalog but will not affect the actual underlying data source.
trans-unit.target: This will remove the metadata for the object from Azure Data Catalog but will not affect the actual underlying data source.

trans-unit.source: An expert is a person who has an informed perspective about a data object.
trans-unit.target: An expert is a person who has an informed perspective about a data object.

trans-unit.source: An object can have multiple experts.
trans-unit.target: An object can have multiple experts.

trans-unit.source: An expert does not need to be the “owner” for an object; the expert is simply someone who knows how the data can and should be used.
trans-unit.target: An expert does not need to be the “owner” for an object; the expert is simply someone who knows how the data can and should be used.

trans-unit.source: During Azure Data Catalog preview, there is no explicit service level agreement.
trans-unit.target: During Azure Data Catalog preview, there is no explicit service level agreement.

trans-unit.source: Please use the Azure Data Catalog forum to report problems, share information, and ask questions. The forum can be found at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=616424&clcid=0x409
trans-unit.target: Please use the Azure Data Catalog forum to report problems, share information, and ask questions. The forum can be found at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=616424&clcid=0x409

trans-unit.source: We’re actively working on adding more data sources to Azure Data Catalog. If there is a data source that you would like to see supported, please suggest it (or voice your support if it has already been suggested) in the Azure Data Catalog forum.
trans-unit.target: We’re actively working on adding more data sources to Azure Data Catalog. If there is a data source that you would like to see supported, please suggest it (or voice your support if it has already been suggested) in the Azure Data Catalog forum.

trans-unit.source: You can think of Azure Data Catalog as an evolution of the Data Catalog.
trans-unit.target: You can think of Azure Data Catalog as an evolution of the Data Catalog.

trans-unit.source: Azure Data Catalog delivers similar capabilities for data source publishing and discovery, but is focused on broader scenarios and not dependent on Office 365.
trans-unit.target: Azure Data Catalog delivers similar capabilities for data source publishing and discovery, but is focused on broader scenarios and not dependent on Office 365.

trans-unit.source: Shortly after the Azure Data Catalog becomes generally available the two catalogs will merge into a single service.
trans-unit.target: Shortly after the Azure Data Catalog becomes generally available the two catalogs will merge into a single service.

trans-unit.source: The user running the Azure Data Catalog registration tool needs permissions on the data source that will allow him to read the metadata from the source.
trans-unit.target: The user running the Azure Data Catalog registration tool needs permissions on the data source that will allow him to read the metadata from the source.

trans-unit.source: If the user also selects to include a preview, then the user must also have permissions that allow him to read in the data from the objects being registered.
trans-unit.target: If the user also selects to include a preview, then the user must also have permissions that allow him to read in the data from the objects being registered.

trans-unit.source: Azure Data Catalog is a cloud service that can work with both cloud and on-premises data sources, delivering a hybrid data source discovery solution.
trans-unit.target: Azure Data Catalog is a cloud service that can work with both cloud and on-premises data sources, delivering a hybrid data source discovery solution.

trans-unit.source: There are currently no plans for a version of the Azure Data Catalog service that will run on-premises.
trans-unit.target: There are currently no plans for a version of the Azure Data Catalog service that will run on-premises.

trans-unit.source: We’re actively working to expand the capabilities of Azure Data Catalog. If there is additional metadata that you would like to see extracted from the data source during registration, please suggest it (or vote for it if it has already been suggested) in the Azure Data Catalog forum. In the future we will allow third parties to add new data source types through an extensibility API.
trans-unit.target: We’re actively working to expand the capabilities of Azure Data Catalog. If there is additional metadata that you would like to see extracted from the data source during registration, please suggest it (or vote for it if it has already been suggested) in the Azure Data Catalog forum. In the future we will allow third parties to add new data source types through an extensibility API.

trans-unit.source: A: Select the data assets in the Azure Data Catalog, and click the “Take Ownership” button.
trans-unit.target: A: Select the data assets in the Azure Data Catalog, and click the “Take Ownership” button.

trans-unit.source: Owners of data assets in Azure Data Catalog can change the visibility settings, to either allow all Catalog users to discover the owned assets, or to restrict the visibility to specific users.
trans-unit.target: Owners of data assets in Azure Data Catalog can change the visibility settings, to either allow all Catalog users to discover the owned assets, or to restrict the visibility to specific users.

trans-unit.source: A: To update the metadata for data assets that are already registered in the Catalog, simply re-register the data source that contains the assets.
trans-unit.target: A: To update the metadata for data assets that are already registered in the Catalog, simply re-register the data source that contains the assets.

trans-unit.source: Any changes in the data source, such as columns being added or removed from tables or views, will be updated in the Catalog, but any annotations provided by users will be maintained.
trans-unit.target: Any changes in the data source, such as columns being added or removed from tables or views, will be updated in the Catalog, but any annotations provided by users will be maintained.

trans-unit.source: If you encounter problems or require assistance with the Azure Data Catalog preview, please post in the <linkText>Azure Data Catalog forum</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you encounter problems or require assistance with the Azure Data Catalog preview, please post in the <linkText>Azure Data Catalog forum</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Head on over to the <linkText>Azure Data Catalog forum</linkText><title></title>. Questions asked there will find their way here.
trans-unit.target: Head on over to the <linkText>Azure Data Catalog forum</linkText><title></title>. Questions asked there will find their way here.
